abstract.text: Options for drawing overlays with SceneKit content that can aid in debugging, used with the
property.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Debug options are bit mask patterns. To display multiple debugging overlays, combine options using the bitwise OR operator.

abstract.text: Create 3D games and add 3D content to apps using high-level scene descriptions, and easily add animations, physics simulation, particle effects, and realistic physically based rendering.
Options for drawing overlays with SceneKit content that can aid in debugging, used with the
property.
Disable all debugging overlays.
Display only wireframe placeholders for geometries in the scene.
Display the bounding boxes for any nodes with content.
Display visualizations for nodes in the scene with attached cameras and their fields of view.
Display visualizations of the constraint objects acting on nodes in the scene.
Display nonsmoothed crease regions for geometries affected by surface subdivision.
Display a point cloud showing intermediate results of the scene analysis that ARKit uses to track device position.
Display the regions affected by each
object in the scene.
Display the locations of each
object in the scene.
Display the regions affected by each
object in the scene.
Display the physics shapes for any nodes with attached
objects.
Display visualizations of the skeletal animation parameters for relevant geometries.
Display geometries in the scene with wireframe rendering.
Display a coordinate axis visualization indicating the position and orientation of the AR world coordinate system.
A light source that can be attached to a node to illuminate the scene.
The physics simulation attributes attached to a scene graph node.
An object that applies forces, such as gravitation, electromagnetism, and turbulence, to physics bodies within a certain area of effect.
Options for choosing the graphics technology for an
object (or other SceneKit renderer) to use for drawing its contents. Used by the
property and the
option when initializing an
object.
A Boolean value that determines whether SceneKit automatically adds lights to a scene.
Options for drawing overlay content in a scene that can aid debugging.
A Boolean value that determines whether SceneKit applies jittering to reduce aliasing artifacts.
The node from which the scene’s contents are viewed for rendering.
The graphics technology SceneKit uses to render the scene.
A Boolean value that determines whether SceneKit displays rendering performance statistics in an accessory view.
A view for displaying 3D SceneKit content.
The rendering API to use for rendering the view (for example, Metal or OpenGL).
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A type that can be converted to and from an associated raw value.
A type that provides mathematical set operations.
A type that can be initialized using an array literal.
A thread-safe type whose values can be shared across arbitrary concurrent contexts without introducing a risk of data races.
A type that presents a mathematical set interface to a bit set.
